author: brendan0099
content: I think that blake2s would be a good candidate hash function here - we anticipate ~20k hashes/s performance for the plonky3 proving system. It also has the advantage that it doesn't impose a performance penalty on zk-proving L1 blocks on certain performant proving systems, unlike Verkle trees, which are tied to a particular finite field.
